comments.body:
Voyager cancellation has PO number and line item number. What do these correspond to in the XML?

XSLT calls notification_data/line/reference_number as "Order Number". The same value populates line/line_reference.

Also:
  <assigned_object>Purchase Order Line</assigned_object>
  <assigned_object_id>15956868980000123</assigned_object_id>
  <assigned_object_name>15-311143</assigned_object_name>
 <poline_title>
              <value>
                <operational_fld>
                  <name>poline_title</name>
                  <value>12111637635_MoveItems5</value>
                </operational_fld>
              </value>
            </poline_title>

Order Number most likely maps to PO number.

What maps to "line item number"?

<item_requested></item_requested>
<item_d>23449600740000123</item_d>
<item_id></item_id>
<originating_item_id></originating_item_id>

XSLT calls notification_data/line/reference_number as "Order Number". The same value populates line/line_reference.

There is however also a field `<poline>` with children 
<item_description>Volume., Amsterdam, Netherlands :, Archis Foundation, No. 1-, 1574-9401, EISSN</item_description>
<title>Volume.</title>
<line_reference>15-316344</line_reference>

Out of the box field <xsl:value-of select="notification_data/vendor/name"/> (called in the default XSLT) does not actually exist in the test file. Using <xsl:value-of select="notification_data/receivers/receiver/vendor/name"/> for the moment; may need to change when we have better test files.
for future reference: there's a typo in quantity field name <items_oredered>1</items_oredered>

What is the point of these variables, which are declared but never used?
<xsl:variable name="conta1">0</xsl:variable>
  <xsl:variable name="stepType" select="/notification_data/request/work_flow_entity/step_type" />
  <xsl:variable name="externalRequestId" select="/notification_data/external_request_id" />
  <xsl:variable name="externalSystem" select="/notification_data/external_system" />

Value of field "Cancellation Note" is  <cancellation_note>cancellation note02121027808</cancellation_note>. I wonder whether this is not a note but the notice number? In which case it used to be at the top in the old layout.
Per documentation, one notice is generated per line, so no for-each is necessary and all fields nested in line can be called directly
Ugh, and what about line/number? Could this be the "Line Item Number"?  `<number>PO-254486</number>`

Ugh, and what is the relationship between notification_data/line and notification_data/po, which contains po_line_list/po_line? Both contain the field number_of_items_ordered, but the value in line is 0 and the value in po_line is 2.

items_oredered occurs in notification_data/line_details, how does that relate?

There's also quantity.

Can not make request as button is disabled

comments.body: Related to #926. I spoke to circ staff on reserve items, if the on_reserve=y flag is set they don't want the items to have any local request options including digitization. The item is reserved for class use. They requested that the button just be suppressed on the record page, spoke to @hectorcorrea about whether or not that is possible, needs some research. If we need to handle this in the form, I asked circulation if we should just send these items to resource sharing or just provide no options.
This should remove the Request button from the Show page (https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/pull/2576) for items on reserves.
